review_title: Used to be a great place to work....
pros: Paycheck. That is about all I can say.
cons: Disconnected and petty upper management. Someone decided to purchase a low quality software system to force upon the employees, making work absolutely miserable and also compromising patient care because it is inadequate for the size of the hospital. Loss of the hospital insurance plan. No hazard pay for many of those who have been working on the front lines since Covid started. Pay is not worth the risks involved in working there.

pros: friendly staff, easy to access,
cons: too far commute for my current situation

review_title: You're a cog in the machine.
job_title: Registered Nurse in Sugar Valley, GA
pros: They do pay better than most hospitals in the area, and the benefits (insurance, retirement, etc) are all pretty good. Plenty of education opportunities IF you ask for them.
cons: Even if you like your director/supervisor, please do not be fooled - you are always expendable and they do a poor job of hiding that from you. Directors and supervisors usually do not "have your back" on anything. While they pay well, if you are due any sort of raise or differential, make sure to check your stubs to confirm you received it; I noticed after 3 months that while I was supposed to be paid a higher rate due to experience, they had not been paying me what I should have been. I brought this to their attention and was told that my correct pay rate would be implemented but they could not pay be back pay. Odd, because I'm sure if I had been overpaid and made them aware, I would have had to pay them back. There is also blatant favoritism in the system. Rules that apply to one person may not be applied to another. You may say "it's the same everywhere", but I've worked places that this was not the case, and transparency and knowing that what is expected of you is expected of all is refreshing - do not expect that here.

review_title: Good general hospital to work for, but has several limitations
pros: Hamilton Medical Center is a general hospital in a small town and the employees are generally long term as there isn't much competition in other places to work.  Everyone knows everyone and you begin to feel like family.  Pay is better than one hour  north, but quite a bit less than an hour south.
cons: It's all in who you know at Hamilton.  If you are liked, you will advance quickly.  Pay is average for this area, but the benefits have been steadily declining over the past few years.

pros: Beautiful hospital and a lot of great people to work with
cons: Administrative changes that came during 2010 and since have unfortunately created a culture that is not conducive for autonomy, or innovation.  The care for patients has declined significantly as evidenced by the poor care my family member received recently.  The nurse was kind, but the room was never cleaned, response times for care were extremely slow, and there was no proactive care or treatments given.

review_title: Wonderful People to work with, hard to start out new due to management.
pros:
- Good nurses and excellent training.
- Push you to be a better nurse.
- Use wellsoft for charting software
cons:
- Management doesn't care as much about you as they do the hospital.
- If your new its hard for them to not to judge you, instead of encourage you.
- Positive news travels slowly, bad news travels quickly (Just like most places)

pros: A variety of shifts available and always opportunities to pick up more hours.
cons: Frequent last-minute shift coverage of others given more as a demand than a request and refusal often results in less offered shifts when the schedule comes out.

pros: Pay.  The differentials are great.  Base salary is ok, but to really make good money you have to work the late or weekend shifts.
cons:
Everything else.  Management gives little care for their employees.  They belittle and degrade.  There have been several instances I've witnessed employees being called to task for issues they have had in front of the staff.   The manager actually degraded her employee in front of others.  

Management does not support their employees.  There is an 85% turnover rate here for a reason.

review_title: I learned true autonomy as a nurse.

cons: nurse to patient ratio is rediculous. They only think money and not aquity of patient load.

pros: Great place to work.  Caring leaders and staff that don't just look at the bottom-line but truly care about the patients, their families and all staff members.
cons: Any opportunities or suggestions that are brought up to management are addressed in a timely manner.

review_title: You will always find a friendly, smiling face.

cons: There is a fast turnover rate for employees, especially nurses, and communication breakdown between the different departments. There are too many computer systems that do not easily interface with other programs.
